Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott S Schuldt was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Attendance to Victim Impact Panel meeting on 8/19/2015 or 20 days huber consecutive.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
DNA surcharge and Blood draw Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. Blood draw costs will be forwarded to the Town of Oconomowoc Police Dept.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Maintain full time employment and-or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (taverns, bars, pubs, liquor stores)
Provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time (nonworking) COMMENCE FORTHWITH. Huber with standard release conditions. Credit for 186 days.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 1/28/15, 3/2/15.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 1/5/2015 at 3:00 p.m.
Associated with Charge #1
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott S Schuldt in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed by operation of law. Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on August 19, 2015 or 20 days Huber consecutive.
- Fine totaling: $3801.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Oconomowoc Police Department - append to fine - to be paid as a condition of probation. 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - append to fine to be paid as a condition of probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 -  270 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH. Credit for 186 days.   Non-working hours with standard release conditions. 
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
Dated June 15, 2015 filed by Attorney Morin advising the Court the parties do not plan to file any motions as they have reached an agreement.
filed by Attorney Morin.

Hearing on April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

THE COURT GRANTS HUBER BAILEE STATUS. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant only to be released during business hours to have SCRAM installed immediately upon release.

THE COURT GRANTS HUBER BAILEE STATUS FOR EMPLOYMENT AND ANY TREATMENT. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant only to be released during business hours to have SCRAM installed immediately upon release. Defendant to post $2500.00 cash bail and sign a $5000.00 signature bond.

Defendant Scott S Schuldt in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for the Motion to Suppress.  Officer Kassens from the Town of Oconomowoc was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense.  Redirect by the state. No arguments by the defense. State presents closing arguments and asks the court to denied the defense motion. Defense presents closing arguments. Court finds there was probable cause for the arrest and the motion is denied. Attorney Morin is requesting that Mr. Schuldt be allowed for bailee status for employment and any treatment. Court grants that request.  Hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott S Schuldt in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Robert K. from the Town of Oconomowoc was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. Redirect by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defense counsel is requesting that the dedefendant be allowed huber bailee status. State objects and presents arguments. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed.
